data.title: Excellent service and food!
data.text: We went to Hinterland to celebrate my partners new job in Green Bay. We had a wonderful time, from the apps, to dinner, dessert and drinks. I got the quail and my partner got the elk loin. Both were amazing. I loved how creative all the food was. This is not a place we can afford to go to often, but I am already excited for our next visit.

data.title: Hinterland Brewery Tour
data.text: I love the beer, but they were understaffed for a 3pm Saturday tour. There was no direction of were to go, who was giving beer tokens, and who was in charge of leading the tour. There were only 2 bartenders on staff, one at each of their bar sections and then one lead the tour leaving the other completely alone. It was not very organized and the tour guide did not have everyone's attention. Many people were off looking on their own and talking making it very difficult to listen to the guide. I look forward to their new facility across from Lambue Field as it should have more space and I hope they have better organization of tours.

data.title: One of the most under appreciated restaurants in Wisconsin
data.text: Hinterland is Fine Dining masquerading as a Brew Pub.  Their food is interesting, creative and delicious.  We've dined both here and the Milwaukee sister restaurant.  Both are among the best, most satisfying dining experiences in the state.  We had 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and dessert.  Everything was (again) absolutely delicious.  Go.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: The Tour Was Excellent
data.text: We just did the tour.  A nice small brewery with a knowledgeable tour guide.  I wish we had time for lunch as the menu looked great.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: Nice atmosphere, but we left after half an hour of sitting at our table and not getting our drinks.  Not good for a brewery!

owner_response.author: HinterlandBeth, Front Office Manager at Hinterland Brewery & Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
My sincerest apologies about your recent experience at Hinterland. We do our best to provide everyone with prompt service and unfortunately, we failed you. Would you please reach out to me via email? I'd like to see what we can do for you to give us another chance.

Thank you,
Beth
beth@hinterlandbeer.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't waste your time.
data.text:
I will never understand how a restaurant encourages bad behavior with the staff. Did not feel welcome and for the prices I was underwhelmed with the quantity and quality of the food.
If it were not for the great beer I would give them zero star rating.
Sucks that these guys will represent at the new Lambeau complex. Not deserved.

owner_response.author: HinterlandBeth, Front Office Manager at Hinterland Brewery & Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm sorry to hear of your most recent visit to Hinterland. I also see this isn't the first time you've had a bad experience with us.

Our chefs take pride in the quality of the food that they bring in and it's our goal to maintain the highest level of execution and flavor. We obviously dropped the ball during your visit. I'd also like to offer my sincerest apologies that you didn't feel welcome during your experience. I'd like to speak with our staff directly about their behavior. Would you please reach out to me via email with any specific examples? I'd also like to see if there's a way that you would give us another shot.

Thank you,
Beth
beth@hinterlandbeer.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food is expensive & portions are small
data.text:
We did the brewery tour, which was good. You get 2 free beers and a pint glass. The staff was really good about letting you sample a beer before deciding. I enjoyed the tour, and would go back for drinks.

The restaurant was disappointing. You are paying for atmosphere and a "pretty" plate of food.

My husband ordered a fish plate for $36. He received a very pretty plate, 1 piece of breaded fish on top of a medley of vegetables. He said it tasted very good, but he was still hungry when he finished it so I offered him some of my plate.

I ordered a $50 rib eye. That did not include a soup or salad, and they do not bring you out any bread while you wait. I ordered it medium-well, but I received medium rare. It was supposed to come with mashed potatoes, but it looks like the chef took a large spoon of potatoes and just swooshed it across my plate and then plopped the rib eye on top of it. Did it look "pretty"? I guess. Did I get more than 3 spoonfuls of potatoes? No. After cutting all the fat of off my rib eye, sharing it with my husband, and eating my 3 spoonfulls of potatoes... we both were still hungry.

We went for his birthday, and I added a note in my reservation that it was for his birthday. I was hoping they would offer a free dessert, or even a free beer...nope.

data.title: Not simply a brewhouse
data.text: Although the craft beer was outstanding, as expected, they also have a first class food and wine menu. The service was friendly and knowledgeable. The building is an older re-furbished meat packing facility which adds to the charm. This was our first stop in Green Bay after traveling and enjoyed it thoroughly. We would definitely return.

data.title: Great environment
data.text: Coolest place to have dinner.  Lots of corners and recliners and couches.  Very professional staff and great food.

data.title: Great service, really good food
data.text: In town for a conference , had a group of 12, it felt like we had their whole staff helping out. The drinks were good, the food was better, the service was great. They make very good beers on site, a. Slice of Green Bay for sure.

data.title: Nice atmosphere and good food.
data.text: Like the trendy atmosphere.  I had the mussels and shared some of the wild mushroom pizza.  The pizza was really good and the broth the mussels were in was excellent.

data.title: Fun restaurant
data.text: This is a fun place to go with very good food.  The atmosphere is very trendy and it can be a bit loud at times, but it is worth it for the food.  You are never disappointed by the meals here.

data.title: Mediocre entrees (not a lot of flavor)
data.text: My husband & I ate at Hinterland a few weeks ago on a Friday night as we wanted to get to the downtown location one more time before they moved to their new location this year near Lambeau Field. We had our wedding reception there 7 years ago & loved the food! Unfortunately we were so disappointed this time, & will not return. I had a barbecue pork loin that had very little flavor, & my husband had the Friday fish special - which was also nearly flavorless, dry, & small (especially for the price). His fries were cold as well. We had a bottle of malbec, & in total our dinner was over $100 - which I would have been happy to spend had it been a nice meal.

owner_response.author: HinterlandBeth, Front Office Manager at Hinterland Brewery & Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm so sorry to hear that your most recent visit didn't live up to the standards of your wedding reception! It's our goal to maintain the highest level of execution and flavor with our dishes and we obviously dropped the ball. Would you please reach out to me via email? I'd like to see if there's a way that you would give us another shot.

Thank you,
Beth
beth@hinterlandbeer.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decent, but would not return.  Skip the dessert.
data.text:
Had the shrimp bisque and cheese plate for an appetizer.  Soup was so good, we thought about licking the bowl!  lol  All 4 adults had the elk steak.  It was delicious and well prepared. Dessert, we should have skipped.  Chocolate hazelnut bread pudding.  It wasn't really warm, more room temperature, didn't have a strong hazelnut OR chocolate flavor and barely reminded us of bread pudding.  The "cobbler" was cold, just out of the refrigerator kind of cold.  It had an oatmeal topping, didn't exactly make you think of a cobbler. 

Waitress indicated that they had "kid's" food off the menu (which was nice of her to mention) and my son ordered a burger.  It was a slider.  1 slider with probably 2 dozen fries.  It would have been nice to know that it was a single slider, but it was not mentioned when we ordered.  

I felt it was overpriced for the quality of food.  Atmosphere was nice and food was above average, however we would not return.

data.title: Micro Cuisine
data.text: We visited Hinterland with another couple while in town for the College Classic. We made reservations for 8pm but showed up at 6:30pm right after the game and were seated immediately. The service was acceptable and the food was delicious. The only exception was dessert. We ordered the bread pudding and our friends ordered the cobbler - neither of which were enjoyed. Great atmosphere, good food but maybe skip dessert.

data.title: Neat brewery with good food
data.text: Very nice restaurant on site of local brewery in downtown Green Bay near the Fox River.  Excellent beers brewed on site - especially recommend the bourbon amber ale!!  Food was better than expected with excellent pork loin and very tender elk loin.  Staff was very inviting and attentive making for a fun night of great food and good beer.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: Stopped by for a sampling of their beers. We had one and had to leave. There were four employees behind the bar at one time and we could not get there attention. After 20 minutes of waiting we did have one ask if we needed anything. We chose the check over another beer!

data.title: Culinary-level experience - great food attractively presented 'like art'
data.text: Really a special place - great chef presenting wonderful choice of daily changing menu. Everyone really enjoyed our varied choices - from delicious Walleye - scrumptious pork chop - great choices all around. Presentation was like looking at piece of art - drizzle of multi-colored finishes to create a mouth-watering look that lived up to the billing when enjoyed. Highly recommend this great culinary experience - lived up to 'foodie' standards!

data.title: Really Great Food and Beer
data.text:
As expected.  Duh.

Since the prices are published on the website menu, I don't know how people can complain about price.  If it's more than you're comfortable paying, find somewhere else to go.  I always did until this past Friday, when I could justify it because of a special occasion.

Host was friendly, almost overly so.  The waitress was efficient and helpful, though not what I'd call outgoing.  Specials were outlined sufficiently.

Their beer is consistently good, so no issues there.  Wife had the pork steak/chop and I had the ribeye.  Both were outstanding, and properly served on heated plates.  Cheese plate was great, and the cured meats were especially good.  The goat cheese polenta cake that came with the ribeye was outstanding.  Dessert?  2 more beers, please.

All in all, a great meal in a fantastic space.  The nicest restaurant I've been to in Green Bay by a million percent. Two snaps up.

data.title: Poor menu
data.text: The menu for dinner was limited.  Only a few choices.  The drinks and food were expensive and they included the tip in the bill and didn't say anything that it was already included so the waitress got a double bonus.  We left cash on the table also,
